authors.author: A.E. Rusbridge Edith Margaret Gellibrand Reed

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
Infant holy, infant lowly,
For His bed a cattle stall;
Oxen lowing, little knowing,
Christ the babe is Lord of all.

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
Swift are winging, angels singing,
Noels ringing, tidings bringing:
Christ the Babe is Lord of all.
Christ the Babe is Lord of all.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
Flocks were sleeping,
Shepherds keeping vigil
Till the morning new;
Saw the glory, heard the story,
Tidings of a gospel true.

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
Thus rejoicing, free from sorrow,
Praises voicing, greet the morrow:
Christ the Babe was born for you.
Christ the Babe was born for you.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
In a manger He is lying,
Who will greet Him as He sleeps?
Baby Jesus, infant Christ child,

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
Who will greet Him as He sleeps?
Angels winging, praises singing,
Noels ringing, tidings bringing:
Christ the Babe is Lord of all.
Christ the Babe is Lord of all.
